intro: Phyllanthus gjellerupii, commonly known as the Gjellerup's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, green leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces clusters of tiny yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
